alert.note: Alert for Dawes (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 03 at 10:12PM CDT until August 03 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM MDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Hydrologic flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of western Nebraska, including the following county, Dawes. * WHEN...Until 1215 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 912 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in Dead Horse Creek and Chadron State Park. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Dead Horse Creek and Chadron State Park is the most likely place to experience flooding. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
